p: Once the flaviviruses are in the endosomes; the acidic pH triggers the assembly of E trimers that leads to the release of the nucleocapside into the cell cytoplasm. Subsequently the capsid-RNA complex leaves the endosome, presumably through the pores (Figure 2 (Fig. 2)). The RNA produces a polyprotein, which is directed to the endoplasmic reticulum, where it is processed by cellular and virus-derived proteases into structural and non-structural proteins (Rodenhuis-Zybert et al., 2010[ 68]; Garcia-Blanco et al., 2016[ 26]).
